Highlights


Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam, is known for its centuries-old architecture and a rich culture with Southeast Asian, Chinese and French influences. At its heart is the chaotic Old Quarter, where the narrow streets are roughly arranged by trade. There are many little temples, including Bach Ma, honoring a legendary horse, plus Đồng Xuân Market, selling household goods and street food.
  • Explore Thang Long Imperial Citadel
  • Enjoy shopping at Hanoi Old Quarter
  • Travel across the Ho Chi Minh complex
  • Explore the peaceful lake of Hoan Kiem with Ngoc Son temple

Itinerary

Day 1 Hanoi arrival

Upon arrival in Hanoi airport, our tour guide and driver will pick you up and transfer you to the hotel for check in Free at your own leisure. Overnight in Hanoi

Day 2 Hanoi full day city tour (B)

08:30am: After breakfast at hotel, join with tour guide for a full day city tour. Tour starts with Ho Chi Minh complex: Ho Chi Minh mausoleum, stilt house, Ba Dinh square, One Pillar pagoda. Then we visit Temple of Literature, which is well known as the first university of Vietnam. Then visit Tran Quoc Pagoda which is regarded as the oldest pagoda in Hanoi. After lunch time, visit Thang Long Imperial Citadel which is a complex of historic imperial buildings located in the centre of Hanoi, Vietnam. Then visit the peaceful lake of Hoan Kiem with Ngoc Son temple, free time for shopping at Hanoi Old Quarter. Overnight in Hanoi.

Day 3 Hanoi – Halong Bay – Hanoi (B/L)

A trip to northern Vietnam would not be completed without a tour to breathtaking Ha Long Bay or the bay of descending dragons that is considered the eighth natural wonder of the world, in a country- incomparable coastal area of 1.600 square kilometers with 2000 limestone islands in various shapes. For one day tour, we'd introduce you to all the beauty of Halong Bay by cruising around the islands visiting the caves. 7:45: You will be picked up at your hotel and then driven to Ha Long Bay. You'll have a short break (about 20 minutes) on the half way before arriving in Halong tourist wharf at 11.45. 12:00 noon: You will board a private boat and cruise through the most beautiful place of the bay with the famous islets such as Cock Fighting, Dinh Huong islets, etc. while enjoying fresh seafood lunch (on boat). You'll also visit Thien Cung Cave (havven grotto). 16:30: You will return to Ha Long tourist wharf and transfer back to Hanoi. We drop you off at your hotel. Your tour will finish at 8.00 pm. Overnight stay in Hanoi

Day 4 Hanoi – Saigon by flight (B) – Saigon half day tour

Breakfast at hotel Then transfer to the airport for flight to Saigon Upon arrival in Saigon airport, our tour guide and driver will pick you up and transfer you to the hotel for check in In the afternoon, you will begin your urban experience in bustling Saigon, the country's commercial center and home to a growing number of upscale shops. Visit the Reunification Palace, the Opera House and the Hotel de Ville and the War Remnants Museum. Then visit Ben Thanh market before ending this day. Overnight in Saigon

Day 5 Saigon – Cu Chi Tunnels – Saigon (B)

Breakfast at hotel Cu Chi Tunnels is now a popular spot for both Vietnamese & foreign tourists - the network of over 200km of tunnels became legendary when they played a vital role in the War. In their heyday, the tunnels were functioning underground cities including numerous trap doors, specially constructed living areas, storage facilities, weapons factories, field hospitals, command centers & kitchens. Start our tour in the morning, before entering the tunnels visitors can watch a short introductory video showing how the tunnels were constructed. You will spend the next hour exploring the tunnels. Afterwards, enjoy tea, cassava (guerrilla’s food during the war). Come back to city in the afternoon Overnight in Saigon

Day 6 Saigon departure (B)

After breakfast, you will be free till our tour guide and driver will pick you up and transfer to airport for departure flight. End of service.
